page.title: 16HEALTH IN EDINBURGH.
page.content: This must be a healthy area with so many golf courses and open spaces-and yet without so much as one well with mineral waters,there are many hospitals_three in a one mile stretch of road and yet tucked away almost unnoticed except for the 'H' sign. The building style of the hospitals ranges too from the classical dignity of the{Corstorphine}to the reserved composure of{Beechwood House}among the trees. Most recent addition is the {Murrayfield Hospital}built in 1984.It is a private hospital on the grounds of the Duns Scotus Academy,now closed.The stone building of the Academy stands proudly aloof from the modern red brick new hospital.Here you can enjoy your ill_health with all comforts provided_at Â£126 a day.The view across to the Pentlands is almost worth it!
